quizzes.title: Literature Quiz: Jack London and Lines
quizzes.description: Test your literature knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Literature, breed, adonais—he. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: He was a close friend of Byron and an incredibly popular singer, songwriter.  Which Irish entertainer and poet, who wrote the lyrics to “The Minstrel Boy,” wrote these lines as well?

options.text: d hearts that once beat high for praise now feel that pulse no more.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Thomas Moore

questions.question: Which novel by Jack London depicts the rise of a fascist-like regime in America?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Iron Heel

questions.question: Which of the following novels by Jack London tells the story of the intellectual Humphrey van Weyden, who is forced to become a common seaman?

options.text: The Little Lady of the Big House

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Sea-Wolf

questions.question: How many wind giants are there in the book The Neverending Story?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 4

questions.question: The life of which character, depicted by Jack London, resembles very much the authors life?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Martin Eden

questions.question: Uyulala, is a character in the novel The Neverending Story, that only speaks in rhymes.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: He was a close friend of Wordsworth. He wrote “Kubla Khan” and the following lines from his most popular poem:
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Coleridge

questions.question: What name does Bastian give to the Childlike Empress in The Neverending Story?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Moon Child

questions.question: Who wrote these famous lines and in what poem can they be found?

options.text: d all ye need to know.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Keats—Ode on a Grecian Urn

questions.question: This conservative, aristocratic poet and novelist was the pride of both Scotland and England. His martial poetry was an inspiration during war. What author of “Waverly” penned the following poem?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sir Walter Scott

questions.question: Which of the following books, published in 1903, brought everlasting fame to Jack London?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Call of the Wild

questions.question: Which of the following tales is not part of the collection Children of the Frost (1902) by Jack London?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: To Build a Fire

questions.question: What breed is the dog Buck, the protagonist in The Call of the Wild by Jack London?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: St. Bernard/Collie mix

questions.question: In the book The Neverending Story, what kind of creature is Engywook?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Gnome

questions.question: I weep for Adonais—he is dead!
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Percy Bysshe Shelly

quizzes.title: Literature Quiz: Roland and Susannah
quizzes.description: Test your literature knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Literature, people, poe. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which of the following novels played a decisive role in Jack Londons life according to his own words, and turned him to literature when he was only eight years old?

options.text: John Esten Cookes The Youth of Jefferson

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ouidas Signa

questions.question: While in Maine, Roland and Eddie hear that they are near the home of the author Stephen King, a name that interests them because of the link with which book in their possession?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Salems Lot

questions.question: Song of Susannah takes place mostly in our world, in New York and which other US State?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Maine

questions.question: Jake and Father Callahan travel to New York of 1999 and store the Wizards Glass known as Black Thirteen in a deposit box under which famous building?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: World Trade Center

questions.question: What was Edgar Allan Poes first poem to be published?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Raven

questions.question: While he has Stephen King hypnotised, Roland implants an instruction in the authors mind, what is it?

options.text: To collect a package from a location in New York City
To write an epic poem about Susan Delgado
To continue writing the Dark Tower series of novels

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: To continue writing the Dark Tower series of novels

questions.question: In 1910 Jack London bought a ranch in Glen Ellen, California, and since then he began to write mostly to finance it.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Jake and Father Callahan attempt to rescue Susannah from a restaurant in New York, where she is being held by the soldiers of The Crimson King. What is the name of the restaurant?

options.text: The Manhattan Restaurant of The Mind

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Dixie Pig

questions.question: In Song of Susannah, Roland and Eddie travel to New York of 1977 in an attempt to buy a plot of land from which man?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Calvin Tower, a bookstore owner

questions.question: When he meets Stephen King, Roland the gunslinger hypnotises him.  What does Roland use to hypnotise people?

options.text: A pendant in the shape of an eye

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A bullet

questions.question: Susannah had left a scrimshaw ornament behind before she was taken into the restaurant, which gave Jake and Father Callahan hope when they found it.  What animal shape had the scrimshaw been carved into?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Turtle

questions.question: The main story in The Little Lady of the Big House  (1916) by Jack London focuses on what?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A love triangle

questions.question: Where was Edgar Allan Poe born?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Massachusetts

questions.question: In Song of Susannah, Susannah is pregnant with whose baby?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Roland

questions.question: Once born, the child carried by Susannah/Mia was called what?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mordred

quizzes.title: Literature Quiz: Novel and The Golden Compass
quizzes.description: Test your literature knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Literature, poe, death. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: In The Golden Compass, what is Lyras daemons favorite form to sleep in?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ermine

questions.question: The story of the novel The Golden Compass begins in the fictional Jordan College in Oxford.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: What branch of the military did Edgar Allan Poe enlist in?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: US Army

questions.question: What was the name of Edgar Allan Poes last book to be published?

options.text: The Masque of the Red Death

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Eureka

questions.question: In the novel The Golden Compass, the Master gives the main character an Alethiometer and instructs her to deliver it to Lord Asriel.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: The death penalty is the main theme of this poem by Oscar Wilde which contains the following often quoted lines:
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Ballad of Reading Gaol

questions.question: What Edgar Allan Poe poem are the following lines from?

options.text: me up, in despite of the lion,
me up, through the lair of the lion,

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ulalume

questions.question: At what age did Edgar Allan Poe die?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 40

questions.question: Who takes the main character of The Golden Compass as a personal assistant?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mrs. Coulter

questions.question: What is the name of the main characters daemon in the novel The Golden Compass?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Pantalaimon

questions.question: What was Edgar Allan Poes only completed novel?

options.text: The Narrative of Arthur Gordon Pym of Nantucket

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Narrative of Arthur Gordon Pym of Nantucket

questions.question: In the novel The Golden Compass, are the main character and her friends often at war with the local children of Oxford?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Yes

questions.question: Which of the following poems was not written by Edgar Allan Poe?

options.text: I Carry Your Heart With Me

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: I Carry Your Heart With Me

questions.question: In the book The Golden Compass, who is the main characters best friend that turns up missing?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Roger

questions.question: What is the mysterious substance that is being researched in the North by Lord Asriel in Phillip Pullmans book The Golden Compass?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dust

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Book and Novel
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, title, barkers. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: In the book The Golden Compass, can adult daemons change into any form they want?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: No

questions.question: The novel Weaveworld was made into a comic series in 1991, published by which comic house?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Epic Comics

questions.question: In Clive Barkers book Weaveworld, what is the name of the magical world which lies woven within a rug?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Fugue

questions.question: Clive Barker had his screenplay for the remake of the Japanese monster film Gojira rejected because it was too dark and disturbing.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Complete the title of this Clive Barker novel, written as a fable for children: The Thief of _________.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Always

questions.question: Which surly, jaded denizen of Ankh-Morpork, depicted by Terry Pratchett, is Commander of the Night Watch?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Samuel Vimes

questions.question: In the Hellraiser film series, what is the name of the puzzle-box used to open the gateway to the other world?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lament configuration

questions.question: What is the name of the magic sea in the book The Great and Secret Show?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Quiddity

questions.question: Which Clive Barker novel tells a Hollywood ghost story?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Coldheart Canyon

questions.question: In the novel The Golden Compass, what do the storytellers call those on the General Oblation Board?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Gobblers

questions.question: Who is Lyras uncle in Philip Pullmans novel The Golden Compass?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lord Asriel

questions.question: This book that launched the Discworld series was first published in the U.K. in 1983.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Colour of Magic

questions.question: The 1987 movie Hellraiser was based upon the Clive Barker novella The Damnation Game.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: In which English city was author Clive Barker born?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Liverpool

questions.question: Which one of these is not a guild from the fictional city of Ankh-Morpork?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sewer Workers Guild

quizzes.title: Literature Quiz: Isaac Asimov and Fiction
quizzes.description: Test your literature knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Literature, fiction, death. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: In what genre of literature other than science fiction did Isaac Asimov write?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: mystery

questions.question: Which of these series was not written by Isaac Asimov?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dune series

questions.question: How many books of the Discworld series were published prior to 2007?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 35

questions.question: In Terry Pratchetts Discworld series, Death once took over The Hogfathers job and attempted to deliver his version of holiday presents to all the children of Discworld, much like in Tim Burtons film, The Nightmare Before Christmas.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: What pen name did Isaac Asimov use for his science fiction series for teenagers titled Lucky Starr?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Paul French

questions.question: Which of these is not a science fiction novel co-written by Isaac Asimov and Robert Silverberg?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Shrouded Planet

questions.question: This book penned by Isaac Asimov won the Hugo (1972), Nebula (1973) and Locus (1973) Awards for best science fiction novel.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Gods Themselves

questions.question: Which of these entries from the Oxford English dictionary is not a word created by Isaac Asimov?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: cyberspace

questions.question: Isaac Asimov and these other two writers were considered the Big Three science-fiction writers during Asimovs lifetime.

options.text: Robert A. Heinlein and Arthur C. Clarke
H. G. Wells and Arthur C Clarke

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Robert A. Heinlein and Arthur C. Clarke

questions.question: What was the name of the first science fiction short story Isaac Asimov wrote?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cosmic Corkscrew

questions.question: Discworld, the fictional planet on which Terry Pratchetts famous series of novels is set, is carried on the back of four great space elephants. What are the elephants standing on?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: ATuin, the star turtle

questions.question: Cohen the Barbarian, the greatest hero that Discworld has ever produced, is about 90 years old. He thinks that which one of these is not one of the greatest things in life?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A lovely bit of music

questions.question: Isaac Asimov suffered from which of the following disorders?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: fear of flying

questions.question: Bloody Stupid Johnson, Discworlds famous dyslexic architect, is Terry Pratchetts version of Leonardo da Vinci.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: What popular musical was parodied by Terry Pratchetts 18th Discworld book, Maskerade?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Phantom of the Opera

quizzes.title: Literature Quiz: Terry Pratchett and Books
quizzes.description: Test your literature knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Literature, pratchett, title. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which of these books by Terry Pratchett does not belong to his Discworld series?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Unadulterated Cat

questions.question: Which of these four books of Terry Pratchetts Discworld series was published first?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Colour of Magic

questions.question: What is the full name of English writer Terry Pratchett born in 1948?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Terence David John Pratchett

questions.question: What was the title of Terry Pratchetts first published work, a short story printed in his school magazine?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Hades Business

questions.question: How did Bilbo Baggins come across the One Ring in the novel The Fellowship of the Ring?

options.text: Gollum gives it to him after their riddles.
When he gets lost in the goblins cave, he finds it in the dirt.
Thorin Oakenshield gave it to him as a gift after the Battle of Five Armies.
He found it in the dragons lair during his journey.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: When he gets lost in the goblins cave, he finds it in the dirt.

questions.question: Which character helped Frodo and Sam rescue Merry and Pippin from the trees?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tom Bombadil

questions.question: In the book The Fellowship of the Ring, Arwen was the elf that brought Frodo Baggins across the river into the land of Rivendell.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: In Terry Pratchetts Discworld series, the lines of what  character are usually  typed in capital letters?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Death

questions.question: What is fantasy writer Terry Pratchetts astrological sign?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Taurus

questions.question: Tolkiens character Frodo was 33 when he left for Rivendell.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: What is the name of writer Terry Pratchetts daughter, born in 1976?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Rhianna

questions.question: When was Terry Pratchett appointed an Officer of the Order of the British Empire for services to literature?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1998

questions.question: Terry Pratchett supports this organization in many ways, one of which is fundraising by auctions where people bid money in order to get a Discworld character named after them in the writers next book.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Orangutan Foundation

questions.question: Which elf did the Hobbits talk to on their way to Bree in the novel The Fellowship of the Ring?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Gildor

questions.question: Which British artist worked on the UK covers of Terry Pratchetts books of the Discworld series until 2001?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Josh Kirby
